thread.title: Angel Reese’s LSU Spoils Alabama’s Historic Night in Jaw-Dropping Fightback - EssentiallySports
thread.title_full: Angel Reese’s LSU Spoils Alabama’s Historic Night in Jaw-Dropping Fightback - EssentiallySports

author: Shahryar Fazal
title: Angel Reese’s LSU Spoils Alabama’s Historic Night in Jaw-Dropping Fightback - EssentiallySports
text: Angel Reese’s LSU Spoils Alabama’s Historic Night in Jaw-Dropping Fightback [](https://bit.ly/4113QfS) Follow Us The largest crowd in Alabama Women’s Basketball history witnessed a resounding double-double from Angel Reese (20 points and 17 rebounds) and Aneesah Morrow (20 points and 11 rebounds) as LSU handed the Crimson Tide a 78-58 defeat. America’s Favorite Video Today After their unsuccessful trip to Auburn, the defending champions got the better of Alabama in front of 5,575 in attendance at the Coleman Coliseum and got their campaign back on track. LSU is back to winning ways ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad The battle was head-to-head in the opening quarter, with LSU holding a slight lead. Following this, Alabama’s vibrant forward Aaliyah Nye went on a scoring spree and got the home team ahead in the closing minutes. Consequently, the Crimson Tide were a point ahead by the end of the first quarter. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad After this, Angel Reese tried to get the lead back for the Lady Tigers with the help of Flau’jae Johnson and Mikayla Williams. But the home team didn’t let their guard down. They remained in front of the back of Nye’s double-digit score. Eventually, despite a combined fightback from Reese and Johnson to get LSU on a 9-0 run, the contest ended 35-34 at half-time in favor of the home team. Trending Nostalgia Strikes Deiondra as Deion Sanders’ 15,000,000 Sale Revives Memories of One ‘Lit Graduation’ Event January 17, 2024 05:03 pm EDT Australian Open News: Coco Gauff Pays the Price for Jessica Pegula’s Nightmarish Afternoon Down Under January 18, 2024 03:02 pm EDT Jim Harbaugh Reported to Reject Michigan’s $69 Million Contract to Join NFL Giants January 18, 2024 01:50 am EDT NASCAR News: Tony Stewart Claims Dale Earnhardt’s Death Robbed NASCAR of Driver Etiquette January 16, 2024 05:06 pm EDT “My Son Passed Away”: Lamar Odom Recalls Life’s Dark Tragedy, Sparked by Draymond Green’s On-Court Struggles January 17, 2024 10:09 pm EDT Get instantly notified of the hottest stories via Google! Click on Follow Us and Tap the Blue Star. [](https://bit.ly/4113QfS) Follow Us The visitors began the second half, firing at all cylinders. Aneesah Morrow, with some assistance from the No. 23 Aalyah Del Rosario, gets the Tigers off to a flying start. Moreover, Morrow became the first LSU Tiger to go past double-digits. Sophomore guard Flau’jae Johnson soon joined her as LSU quickly found themselves in the driving seat. Apparently, they were 20-3 in the first 6 minutes of the third quarter. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad In the end, Alabama was unable to contain the ruthless LSU offense led by Reese and Morrow and ended up losing the contest.
